text: Patricia "Tricia" DeGennaro is an adjunct professor at New York University's Department of Politics and a Senior Fellow at the World Policy Institute.Patricia DeGennaro, World Policy Institute. ==Education== DeGennaro holds an MPA in International Security and Conflict Resolution, from Harvard University, and an MBA in International Trade and Finance, from George Washington University.Patricia DeGennaro, personal webpage. ==Career== DeGennaro has been a regular columnist for the Huffington PostPatricia DeGennaro, Huffington Post. and an expert source for CNN, CNN International, BBC News, Al Jazeera,Former prime minister Gulbaldin Hekmatyar could return to Afghanistan under proposal, Al Jazeera. PBS's Worldfocus,US must seek alternate routes to Afghanistan, Worldfocus. PressTv's Hearts & Minds, Laura Flanders,The deadly infantilization of American politics, gritTV with Laura Flanders. Lorna Owens,Women must be apart [sic] of the dialogue, Lorna Owens. and NPR's Leonard Lopate. She specializes in the Middle East, the Balkans, Afghanistan, and South Asia. She speaks Albanian, Arabic, Dari, and Italian. ==References== Category:Living people Category:American political scientists Category:HuffPost writers and columnists Category:John F. Kennedy School of Government alumni Category:George Washington University School of Business alumni Category:Year of birth missing (living people) Category:Women political scientists
title: Patricia DeGennaro
